website_summaries.verdict: It's not for everyone. But if you're a manual-control freak who views the world at a wide angle and won't miss a viewfinder, the Fujifilm X70 is a great camera.
pros: Great photo quality for the money and a manual-friendly design are the Fujifilm X70's high points
cons: It has slow autofocus and some annoying controls

customer_reviews.title: Great compact camera
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoying this camera. Good resolution. Film simulations are great. Excellent color. Raw files are working great in Luminar software. I was a little worried about battery life but that has not been an issue. In fact I haven't had to use a spare battery yet. Form factor is great. Manual controls are excellent. Screen has been good even in daylight. I love this camera but it is really geared toward advanced amateurs in terms of physical controls. Auto mode works very well but really only scratches the surface of what this little camera is capable of. Very happy with Fujifilm.
customer_reviews.author: Youser

customer_reviews.title: A great travel and street camera.
customer_reviews.text: A great travel and street camera. My Nikon SLR was being serviced, so I brought this on a trip. Loved the Fuji and didn't miss the Nikon. Fuji needs to make a few improvements (better AF, auto detecting wide angle lens,better battery life, etc), but no major issues. In bright sun, lcd can occasionally be difficult to use -- this didn't cause any major problems. I don't use the video feature.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Murray

customer_reviews.title: Perfect portable companion
customer_reviews.text: I own an XT-1 and an x100t. Did not need to own this. But it fits in your pocket and becomes immediately more portable than the x100.. which means I'm shooting a lot more and capturing random moments. I didn't expect to like it this much. Definitely a great vacation camera for fuji enthusiasts.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Great travel camera
customer_reviews.text: Perfect travel camera for me. Lightweight, compact, fast af and aperture, sharp lens, and great image quality. 28mm focal length is good for travel shots, landscapes and street. Jpegs have outstanding color reproduction. WiFi interface works well. Tilt screen is perfect for taking photos from odd angles, or discreet photos from around your neck. If you like to travel light yet want pictures with good image quality, I would highly recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: dontblink97

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed by this mini camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera met all my expectations - very sharp pictures and color resolution - this is a very small camera - I have a X-Pro-1, XT-1 and X100T - I was looking for a smaller travel street camera and stayed with Fuji family of products for their high quality and reliability. The manual focus ring is a challenge which is small and buffered right next to the F-stop ring - my only real complaint - most manual functions work well and the auto switch comes in handy when I want to go the auto mode fast.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Mizrahi

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Camera
customer_reviews.text: Great camera! This is an amazing camera for those that want a mirror-less digital camera that you can treat like the older cameras of the past. It has a lot of manual dials around the camera for changing the aperture, ISO, F-stop, and others. It's great for those that want to have the "unlimited" film of digital cameras, but still have the "old-school" feel. Obviously, Fuji's other cameras have aspects that are better, but this camera is amazing for the price and a great way to get back into photography in the digital age.
customer_reviews.author: Justin P

customer_reviews.title: Best Camera of Its Type
customer_reviews.text: The Ricoh GR and Fuji X70 are the two best small APS-C quality cameras. While their picture quality is about equal, the X70 offers both built-in flash and articulated rear screen. Highly recommended, although sadly the X70 is now out of production. I have three of them!
customer_reviews.author: Enty46

customer_reviews.title: Great advanced point & shoot!
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Really like this camera! The lens width (18.5mm) equals about what I see on my iPhone. The large sensor (APS-C) renders really sharp and detailed results. The many manual options, filters & effects make for a creative effort. Overall, a GREAT point and shoot. I'm enjoying it more than my old RX100! The retro look is cool too!
customer_reviews.author: J. Faulkner

customer_reviews.title: This camera works flawlessly for a novice like me. The best thing about it is that ...
customer_reviews.text: This camera works flawlessly for a novice like me. The best thing about it is that you don't have to mess around on the menu screen if you simply want to change the exposure quickly between shots. A good quality camera for a beginner like me, its perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Criseida Valdez

customer_reviews.title: Grabs great photos, and I actually don't mind carrying it
customer_reviews.text: My everyday pocket camera. Grabs great photos, and I actually don't mind carrying it. Low light capabilities are great.
customer_reviews.author: Cornblade

customer_reviews.text: I have owned this camera just over a year and love every bit of it! I have owned many higher end DSLR systems but this is so much fun to use! Small enough to fit in your pocket it's the perfect travel camera. The colours are just beautiful!! I would recommend this to anyone!!
customer_reviews.author: cameron

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, a tad larger than the GRII but ...
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, a tad larger than the GRII but still fits the pocket. Pictures have terrific tone and color, easy to learn.
customer_reviews.author: R. P.

customer_reviews.title: Found what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: Meets all my expectations and more. Have been searching for a small camera that I can carry with me conveniently and yet matches the image quality of my high end Nikon DSLR. Found it! Easy to carry it in a belt case just like I do my cell phone. Low light performance is amazing. Focusing is quick and accurate. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: M. Brown

customer_reviews.title: ... who interesting in photography know that this camera is great. I got exactly what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Every one who interesting in photography know that this camera is great. I got exactly what I expected. I think it a bit overpriced for descontinue product. But the buying experience was above my expectations. Amazon informed me about every single step. Relatively quick delivery (for Australia). Also was easy to track the parcel progress.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great, pocketable
customer_reviews.text: A great, pocketable, take me everywhere camera. If you enjoy the effective 28mm focal length like I do, it's a jewel. As good if not better than the underrated XF18. I've read a lot of comparisons to the Ricoh GR/GRII and it's a toss up as far as reviews are concerned. The one thing that kept me from the Ricoh were the many many complaints of sensor dust; that was a killer for me. No dust issues with the Fuji.
customer_reviews.author: 10splayer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I loved this camara so much! It is a great camera
customer_reviews.author: Silvia Fidel

customer_reviews.title: Great travel and street photography camera!
customer_reviews.text: I am a Nikon DSLR shooter ( D90, D7200 and P900 )but I heard a lot about Fujifilm X series and wanted to see what all the hoopla was about. I checked out the X100T but did not like the viewfinder so when the X70 was announced I pulled the trigger. First off the camera is small enough to fit in my pocket and it handles like a precision instrument. I have not shot in RAW yet because the JPEGS are just insane. Low light performance is awesome and after a little while the controls are very intuitive. Here are 2 unedited JPEG shots with the Classic Chrome film simulation. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: VinnyTheIcepick

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic JPG engine.
customer_reviews.text: The image quality of this little thing is amazing. I hardly take my DSLR's out anymore. I had my eye on the GRII and the LX100; but I really wanted the film simulations Fuji are known for. I don't want to process RAW for every shot I take, the JPG engine on this thing is the best I've ever used/seen. I shoot RAW on this thing maybe 2% of the time (vs.100% of the time with my DSLR's).
customer_reviews.author: Me.

customer_reviews.title: I'm digging this camera
customer_reviews.text: Great Camera...perfect for me...large camera IQ in an incredibly small package.
customer_reviews.author: ikehayden

customer_reviews.title: Exceeding every expectation, my favorite camera to date.
customer_reviews.text: The image quality is amazing and so easy to use. Best of all its small and discreet, ideal for street shooting. I've had an XE-1 previously and really never took to Fuji. I'm glad that I gave it one more chance.
customer_reviews.author: jss273nyc

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase I made for years!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is built for street photography. It's so small that I can carry it everywhere. The quality is simply amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Nikita

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is beautiful and works well. I satisfied abot this X70.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful little camera
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful little camera. This is my third Fuji. I have an X-T1, The X70 is replacing an X100S. I was a bit worried about not having a viewfinder. Not a problem. Solidly build with superb image quality!
customer_reviews.author: Monty M

customer_reviews.title: I like it, but the menu stinks
customer_reviews.text: I like it, but the menu stinks. I've had to reset it three times so far. Image quality is great for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Artur Ciesielski

customer_reviews.title: Battery issues
customer_reviews.text: The camera itself is a great camera. The pivoting screen, the lens, the overall build quality. Why 2 stars? Because this battery is failing after a couple of months of use. I'm in communication with Fujifilm's customer support. If this improves or they're able to send me a new battery or new camera, then I'll revise my rating.
customer_reviews.author: Candido Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: The camera is new, but no lens cap and protectice cover.
customer_reviews.author: danwei

customer_reviews.title: Too complicated to work! I even watched a video ...
customer_reviews.text: Too complicated to work! I even watched a video to help. Just too much work, I would have returned it if my husband had not trashed the box!
customer_reviews.author: toalclan

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed... I was expecting a better quality of pictures and decided to return it thanks to Amazon great policy. This is not a bad camera, just not the one for me. I am used to DSLR and was really hoping for the same image quality. I was also disappointed by the reactivity and overall interface of the X70. Now waiting on the XT-2. Pricier but more in line with my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Focusing is an issue, I really haven't used it enough. Still reading the manuel.
customer_reviews.author: TLavine

customer_reviews.title: like the charger
customer_reviews.text: This camera came USED and without all of the parts, like the charger.
customer_reviews.author: B. Coniglio

customer_reviews.title: Was not a brand new camera.
customer_reviews.text: Paid full price for a new camera, and received one that was clearly already opened and used.
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera but way too expensive for the what you ...
customer_reviews.text: Great Camera but way too expensive for the what you get. THERE IS NO ZOOM ON THIS CAMERA!!! PLEASE BE AWARE!!! Photos were great but unfortunately you would need another camera for zoom photos.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Buy a memory card, buy a memory card, buy a memory card!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Fujifilm X70 Digital Camera (Silver)
product_meta.description: Color:Silver| Style:BaseThe X70 Premium Compact Camera is a camera for everyday use. Featuring a 18.5mm (28mm equivalent) F2.8 wide-angle fixed lens capable of covering everything from snapshots to landscapes. The newly designed FUJINON lens is optimized for the 16.3 MP APS-C sized X-Trans II Sensor and produces outstanding detail and sharpness. The small and lightweight X70 offers intuitive operation with at-a-glance checking of important exposure settings. The lens features an aperture ring, while shutter speeds and exposure compensation are controlled by dials on the top -plate. Apertures can be changed in 1/3 or 1 stop increments for precise control, while the dials are milled from aluminum for ease of use and a comfortable feel. Selecting AUTO on the top-plate Auto Mode Selector Lever switches the X70 to Advanced SR Auto, where it automatically selects the optimal settings according to the scene. This delivers instant high-quality results with settings chased based on 54 pre-programmed scenes. The X70 features Intelligent Hybrid AF, which automatically switches between Phase Detection AF (best for speed) and Contrast AF (best for low light). The phase detection pixels in the center of the image sensor deliver AF speeds as short as 0.1 sec. Six AF modes, including Zone and Wide/Tracking for moving subjects, will ensure you capture the subject, whatever the conditions. The X70 is the first X-Series camera to feature a 3.0-inch 1.04 million-dot 180 degree tilting touchscreen LCD screen allowing users to shoot from a wide variety of angles and flipping the screen 180 degree upwards is perfect for selfies. When shooting, the touchscreen allows users to select a focus area and use Touch Shot to take a picture quickly. Other features not to be overlooked: 11 Film Simulation Modes based on color reproduction technology perfected through more than 80 years of film manufacturing. Remote shooting and download using the FUJIFILM Camera Remote App.
feature_bullets: 16.3 MP APS-C sized X-Trans II Sensor w/ EXR Processor II
Newly developed 18.5mm (28mm equivalent) F2.8 wide-angle fixed lens
Exposure control using shutter speed dial and aperture ring
Six types of High-Speed / High-Precision AF Modes

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars90 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
